model

Class Main

  • java.lang.Object
    • javafx.application.Application
      • model.Main

  • public class Main
extends javafx.application.Application
    The Game Of Life is a cellular automaton invented by the mathematician John Conway in 1970. This is a simple implementation in Java using the JavaFX UI library.
    Author:
    Al Smith al@whitefootsmiith.com
    See Also:
    Wikipedia.

    Because the Game is Turing-complete, there is no algorithm that can predict whether a given starting pattern will run forever or eventually settle into a periodic steady state - this is a corollary of the "halting problem". Have fun!

      • startGame

        protected void startGame()
        Called when the Play button is pressed. Passes the value from the grid size slider to the GameController class, and resizes the main window based on the size of the CellButtons and the dimensions of the grid.
